title: Artemis Account Activation Guide
content: If a user account is inactive in Artemis, the administrator must navigate to Admin Console > User Management > Select User > Activate Account. Accounts are auto-deactivated after 90 days of inactivity. Users can also self-reactivate by clicking the reactivation link sent to their registered email.

title: Business View Permissions in Artemis
content: To view business data in Artemis, a user must have the BUSINESS_VIEWER or BUSINESS_ADMIN role assigned. Roles are managed in Admin Console > Roles & Permissions. If a user cannot see business records, verify their role assignment and ensure the business unit is linked to their profile.

title: Creating Support Tickets in Artemis
content: Support tickets in Artemis can be created via the Help Desk portal or through the Artemis API endpoint POST /api/v1/tickets. Required fields: title, description, priority (LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH/CRITICAL), and category. Tickets are auto-assigned to the on-call support queue. SLA timers start immediately upon creation.

title: Viewing Ticket Details in Artemis
content: Ticket details can be retrieved via GET /api/v1/tickets/{ticketId}. Each ticket contains: status (OPEN/IN_PROGRESS/RESOLVED/CLOSED), assignee, priority, created timestamp, comments, and resolution notes. Tickets can also be viewed in the Artemis portal under Support > My Tickets.

title: Updating User Status in Artemis
content: User status in Artemis can be ACTIVE, INACTIVE, SUSPENDED, or PENDING_VERIFICATION. Admins can update status via Admin Console > User Management or via PUT /api/v1/users/{userId}/status. Status changes trigger email notifications to the affected user. Suspended users cannot log in until status is restored to ACTIVE.

title: Diagnosing App Crashes in Artemis
content: Artemis crash reports are stored in the Monitoring Dashboard under Diagnostics > Crash Reports. Each crash entry includes: timestamp, affected module, stack trace, user session ID, and environment (prod/staging). Common causes: memory overflow, network timeout (30s default), stale session tokens. For critical crashes, escalate to the Platform Engineering team via the #artemis-platform Slack channel.

title: Artemis Slack Integration Overview
content: The Artemis Slack integration allows users to query account status, create tickets, and receive automated diagnostics directly from Slack channels. Commands are processed by the AI assistant which maps natural language to Artemis APIs. For setup, contact your Artemis administrator to enable the Slack app for your workspace.
